Italian naval ship shoots down drone in Red SeaAn Italian navy ship shot down a drone flying towards it in the Red Sea on Saturday, the defence ministry said. Sat, 02 Mar 2024 18:49:33 GMT 2CGZETPCQ5IPVHCFXSMHYV7DSA https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/italian-naval-ship-shoots-down-drone-red-sea-2024-03-02/Reuters世界中东地区
Yemen's Houthis blame UK and US for 'glitch' in Red Sea undersea cablesThe Houthi Transport Ministry in Yemen said on Saturday there had been a "glitch" in undersea communication cables in the Red Sea as a result of actions by U.S. and British naval vessels. Kamala Harris will talk Gaza ceasefire, aid in DC meeting with Benny GantzU.S. Vice President Kamala Harris will meet with Israeli war cabinet member Benny Gantz at the White House on Monday as Washington seeks to reach a deal for a temporary ceasefire and increase the flow of aid to Gaza. Danish Conservative People's Party leader Soren Pape Poulsen dies, party saysSoren Pape Poulsen, the leader of Denmark's opposition Conservative People's Party, died on Saturday after suffering a cerebral hemorrhage, his party said. He was 52. Thousands join Israeli hostage families in march on JerusalemA march by thousands of Israelis demanding the release of hostages held in Gaza reached Jerusalem on Saturday as negotiators prepared to resume ceasefire negotiations in Cairo that would include a swap deal with Hamas. Eight arrested as climate activists break into chemicals plant in FranceSeveral hundred protesters briefly broke into a plant owned by chemicals group Arkema near Lyon in southeastern France on Saturday to protest against alleged pollution from the site and eight people were arrested, local authorities said on Saturday. Armenia says it's ready for peace deal if Azerbaijan shows political willArmenia is ready to sign a peace agreement with Azerbaijan if Baku shows the same political will, and is keen to make progress on normalising relations with Turkey, a senior Armenian official said on Saturday. US carries out first airdrop of aid into GazaThe U.S. military on Saturday carried out its first airdrop of aid into Gaza, after the deaths of Palestinians queuing for food underlined the growing humanitarian catastrophe in the crowded coastal enclave after months of Israeli military operations. US makes its first Gaza aid airdrop as mediators to seek truce dealThe United States military carried out its first airdrop of humanitarian aid into Gaza on Saturday, U.S. officials said, and aid agencies warned of a growing humanitarian disaster in the Palestinian enclave as Israel pressed on with its offensive. Russians lay flowers at Navalny's grave, hail him as symbol of hopeRussians queued on Saturday to place flowers on the grave of late opposition politician Alexei Navalny, with mourners hailing him as a symbol of hope and perseverance the day after he was laid to rest in Moscow.
